title: Malibu Fire: Thousands evacuated as blaze continues to expand, destroying structures
content: A fast-moving wildfire, the Franklin Fire, erupted in Malibu, California, forcing thousands to evacuate and threatening numerous structures. Driven by strong Santa Ana winds, the fire quickly spread across over 2,200 acres. Firefighters battled the blaze, hampered by extreme winds, while Pepperdine University and surrounding areas faced significant threats.
summary: A fast-moving wildfire, the Franklin Fire, erupted in Malibu, California, forcing thousands to evacuate and threatening numerous structures. Driven by strong Santa Ana winds, the fire quickly spread across over 2,200 acres. Firefighters battled the blaze, hampered by extreme winds, while Pepperdine University and surrounding areas faced significant threats.

title: Luigi Mangione shouts as he's brought for extradition hearing: 'It's an insult...'
content: It's extremely out of touch and an insult to the intelligence of the American people and the lived experience," he said as he was led into a Pennsylvania courthouse. Dressed in an orange prison jumpsuit, Luigi was seen screaming to send out his message. He will have to be transferred to New York City where he coldbloodedly shot Thompson dead.

Dressed in an orange prison jumpsuit, Luigi was seen screaming to send out his message. He will have to be transferred to New York City where he coldbloodedly shot Thompson dead.

title: Luigi Mangione's first meal behind bars revealed: A square slice of pizza
content: Luigi Mangione calmed down at the police station when officers shared with him a square slice of pizza which was his first meal after his arrest. The police released new footage of the 26-year-old suspected killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in which he was seen having a hash brown at McDonald's minutes before he was arrested.
summary: Luigi Mangione calmed down at the police station when officers shared with him a square slice of pizza which was his first meal after his arrest. The police released new footage of the 26-year-old suspected killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in which he was seen having a hash brown at McDonald's minutes before he was arrested.

title: Watch: Utah man rams car into dealership over 'as-is' policy dispute; arrested
content: A Utah man, dissatisfied with a recently purchased Subaru Outback and denied a refund by Tim Dahle Mazda due to their "as-is" policy, drove the vehicle through the dealership's showroom. He was arrested for felony criminal mischief and reckless endangerment after causing substantial damage, though no injuries were reported.
summary: A Utah man, dissatisfied with a recently purchased Subaru Outback and denied a refund by Tim Dahle Mazda due to their "as-is" policy, drove the vehicle through the dealership's showroom. He was arrested for felony criminal mischief and reckless endangerment after causing substantial damage, though no injuries were reported.

title: LGBT news giant PinkNews faces allegations of sexual misconduct and toxic culture
content: PinkNews, a prominent LGBT+ news platform, faces serious allegations of sexual misconduct and bullying by its founders, Benjamin Cohen and Anthony James. Multiple former employees have accused Cohen and James of inappropriate behavior, including unwanted touching and advances. A toxic work environment fostered by excessive drinking and verbal abuse has also been reported, casting a shadow over the organization's reputation.
summary: PinkNews, a prominent LGBT+ news platform, faces serious allegations of sexual misconduct and bullying by its founders, Benjamin Cohen and Anthony James.  Multiple former employees have accused Cohen and James of inappropriate behavior, including unwanted touching and advances.  A toxic work environment fostered by excessive drinking and verbal abuse has also been reported, casting a shadow over the organization's reputation.

title: Did Donald Trump Jr send this birthday message to Bettina Anderson? Where is Kimberly Guilfoyle?
content: ​DailyMail snapped Don Jr and Anderson together at a cafe in West Palm Beach where they were celebrating Anderson's birthday. The report said Don Jr spends most of his time now at Anderson's townhome in West Palm Beach and not at the Florida mansion that he and Kimberly Guilfoyle bought together after their engagement in December 2020.
summary: ​DailyMail snapped Don Jr and Anderson together at a cafe in West Palm Beach where they were celebrating Anderson's birthday. The report said Don Jr spends most of his time now at Anderson's townhome in West Palm Beach and not at the Florida mansion that he and Kimberly Guilfoyle bought together after their engagement in December 2020.

title: X-ray of Luigi Mangione's 'stapled spine' viral: 'I'd kill someone too if...'
content: ​The photo of the X-ray of Luigi Mangione's spine, sourced from his X profile, is going viral and social media users exclaimed that he was probably subjected to a botched surgery. "I'd kill someone too if they did this to me," one user wrote explaining that probably Mangione had a lumbar fusion.

title: US says it will support new Syrian leaders who protect women and renounce terrorism
content: The US pledged to recognize and support a new Syrian government committed to renouncing terrorism, destroying chemical weapons, and protecting minority rights. Following the collapse of the Assad regime, the US will collaborate with Syrian groups and regional partners to ensure a smooth transition, potentially including dialogue with the former rebel group HTS, despite its terrorist designation.
summary: The US pledged to recognize and support a new Syrian government committed to renouncing terrorism, destroying chemical weapons, and protecting minority rights.  Following the collapse of the Assad regime, the US will collaborate with Syrian groups and regional partners to ensure a smooth transition, potentially including dialogue with the former rebel group HTS, despite its terrorist designation.

title: Luigi Mangione: UnitedHealthcare CEO murder suspect used to play renowned ‘Among Us’ game
content: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old former Ivy League student, was arrested for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Mangione, once part of an online gaming group, was found with a 3D-printed firearm and a manifesto. His online activity had become increasingly radicalized in recent years, contrasting sharply with his former persona.
summary: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old former Ivy League student, was arrested for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Mangione, once part of an online gaming group, was found with a 3D-printed firearm and a manifesto. His online activity had become increasingly radicalized in recent years, contrasting sharply with his former persona.

title: Florida man arrested after fatally shooting father over gaming addiction
content: A 23-year-old Florida man, Joseph Voigt, is accused of fatally shooting his father and critically wounding his mother during a dispute about his unemployment and gaming habits. After fleeing to Orlando, Voigt was apprehended and confessed to the crime. He now faces murder and attempted murder charges, having been released from jail days prior on a battery charge.
summary: A 23-year-old Florida man, Joseph Voigt, is accused of fatally shooting his father and critically wounding his mother during a dispute about his unemployment and gaming habits.  After fleeing to Orlando, Voigt was apprehended and confessed to the crime. He now faces murder and attempted murder charges, having been released from jail days prior on a battery charge.

title: Diddy Combs: Was Jay-Z being 'extorted' by minor victim's lawyer?
content: In response, Jay-Z filed a lawsuit against Buzbee, accusing him of attempting to "extort exorbitant sums" based on unfounded allegations. Filed as "John Doe" on November 18 in Los Angeles Superior Court, Jay-Z’s legal team described the tactics as an "attempt to silence wildly false allegations of sexual assault" through monetary demands.
summary: In response, Jay-Z filed a lawsuit against Buzbee, accusing him of attempting to "extort exorbitant sums" based on unfounded allegations. title: Is Luigi Mangione richer than UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson?
content: Anti-capitalist Luigi Mangione's late grandfather was a multimillionaire who owned country clubs, nursing homes, and more. Mangione's protest is against the healthcare industry but his family donated to hospitals and has a long association with the industry. As more and more details emerge about his wealthy family, it seems his family wealth is probably more than that of the CEO he killed.
summary: Anti-capitalist Luigi Mangione's late grandfather was a multimillionaire who owned country clubs, nursing homes, and more.  Mangione's protest is against the healthcare industry but his family donated to hospitals and has a long association with the industry. As more and more details emerge about his wealthy family, it seems his family wealth is probably more than that of the CEO he killed.

title: UnitedHealthcare CEO Murder: What do Elon Musk, Donald Trump and Luigi Mangione have in common?
content: The University of Pennsylvania (UPenn) has shaped the lives of notable alumni like Donald Trump, Elon Musk, and Luigi Mangione, whose paths diverged significantly. Trump, Wharton Class of 1968, focused on real estate and finance, paving the way for his business and political career. Musk, graduating in 1997 with degrees in Economics and Physics, applied his interdisciplinary expertise to revolutionize technology. Mangione, an engineering graduate (2020), initially excelled in computer science and innovation but shocked the world with his recent arrest for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. His actions highlight a tragic turn from promise to notoriety.
summary: The University of Pennsylvania (UPenn) has shaped the lives of notable alumni like Donald Trump, Elon Musk, and Luigi Mangione, whose paths diverged significantly. Trump, Wharton Class of 1968, focused on real estate and finance, paving the way for his business and political career. Musk, graduating in 1997 with degrees in Economics and Physics, applied his interdisciplinary expertise to revolutionize technology. title: Has Taylor Lorenz been fired from Vox after she 'felt joy' over Brian Thompson's murder?
content: Former Washington Post and Vox journalist Taylor Lorenz sparked controversy after expressing "joy" over the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Lorenz defended her reaction, citing the suffering caused by insurance companies. Reports claimed Lorenz was fired by Vox after her controversial statement but Lorenz said her YouTube channel is independent.

title: Nancy Mace's 2017 video kissing another woman goes viral: What is 'baby birding'?
content: The video, reportedly from 2017, shows Mace participating in a drinking game where she and another woman engage in an act known as "baby birding." This practice involves passing a shot of liquor mouth-to-mouth, often seen as intimate or provocative. At the time, the video drew criticism for being inappropriate, and its recent reemergence has reignited discussions about her personal conduct and political stance.

title: Trudeau: Canada ‘will respond’ if Trump imposes tariffs
content: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has warned of retaliatory measures if US President-elect Donald Trump imposes new tariffs, citing the success of similar actions in 2018. Trump, who recently dined with Trudeau, reiterated his intention to implement a 25% tariff on Canadian and Mexican imports unless migration and fentanyl flows are addressed.
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has warned of retaliatory measures if US President-elect Donald Trump imposes new tariffs, citing the success of similar actions in 2018. Trump, who recently dined with Trudeau, reiterated his intention to implement a 25% tariff on Canadian and Mexican imports unless migration and fentanyl flows are addressed.

title: Tulsi Gabbard ignores question on Assad: '...issue that's in the headlines right now'
content: In her statement on Syria, Tulsi Gabbard did not mention Assad whom she met in 2017, and said she stands in full support of what President-elect Donald Trump said on Syria. Donald Trump said whatever is happening in Syria is not America's fight and US military should stay out of it. Trump said Assad did not deserve US support to stay in power after his government collapsed and Assad left the country.
summary: In her statement on Syria, Tulsi Gabbard did not mention Assad whom she met in 2017, and said she stands in full support of what President-elect Donald Trump said on Syria. Donald Trump said whatever is happening in Syria is not America's fight and US military should stay out of it. Trump said Assad did not deserve US support to stay in power after his government collapsed and Assad left the country.

title: Is Brian Thompson killer suspect Luigi Mangione in a relationship? Wild conspiracy theories claim...
content: Luigi Mangione, the person of interest in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, was reportedly not dating anyone or in a relationship because of his spine condition. "He knew that dating and being physically intimate with his back condition wasn't possible. I remember him telling me that, and my heart just breaks," RJ Martin, close to Mangione, said.

title: Brian Thompson killing: What are the charges against UnitedHealthcare CEO’s suspected murderer Luigi Mangione?
content: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old Ivy League graduate, was arrested in Pennsylvania for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Mangione was found with a 3D-printed gun, silencer, and forged ID. A manifesto detailing anti-capitalist views and grievances against the healthcare industry was also recovered, suggesting a possible motive.
summary: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old Ivy League graduate, was arrested in Pennsylvania for the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Mangione was found with a 3D-printed gun, silencer, and forged ID. A manifesto detailing anti-capitalist views and grievances against the healthcare industry was also recovered, suggesting a possible motive.

title: Brazil's Lula undergoes surgery for 'intracranial hemorrhage'; stable in ICU
content: Brazilian President Lula da Silva, 79, underwent successful surgery for a brain hemorrhage on Monday night in Sao Paulo. The hemorrhage was a result of a fall in October. He is currently stable and recovering in intensive care. Lula had previously canceled a BRICS summit appearance due to the injury.
summary: Brazilian President Lula da Silva, 79, underwent successful surgery for a brain hemorrhage on Monday night in Sao Paulo.  The hemorrhage was a result of a fall in October.  He is currently stable and recovering in intensive care.  Lula had previously canceled a BRICS summit appearance due to the injury.
